nodes.label: Pythagorean Identity
nodes.title: The fundamental trigonometric identity: cos²A + sin²A = 1.

nodes.label: Sine Rule
nodes.title: A formula relating the sides and angles of a triangle: a/sin A = b/sin B = c/sin C.

nodes.label: Cosine Rule
nodes.title: A formula relating the sides and angles of a triangle: a² = b² + c² – 2bc cos A.

nodes.label: Cosine of Difference Formula
nodes.title: Formula for cos(A–B): cos(A–B) = cos A cos B + sin A sin B.

nodes.label: Cosine of Sum Formula
nodes.title: Formula for cos(A+B): cos(A+B) = cos A cos B – sin A sin B.

nodes.label: Double Angle Formula for Cosine
nodes.title: Formula for cos 2A: cos 2A = cos²A – sin²A.

nodes.label: Sine of Sum Formula
nodes.title: Formula for sin(A+B): sin(A+B) = sin A cos B + cos A sin B.

nodes.label: Sine of Difference Formula
nodes.title: Formula for sin(A–B): sin(A–B) = sin A cos B – cos A sin B.

nodes.label: Tangent of Sum Formula
nodes.title: Formula for tan(A+B): tan(A+B) = (tan A + tan B) / (1 – tan A tan B).

nodes.label: Tangent of Difference Formula
nodes.title: Formula for tan(A–B): tan(A–B) = (tan A – tan B) / (1 + tan A tan B).

nodes.label: Double Angle Formula for Sine
nodes.title: Formula for sin 2A: sin 2A = 2 sin A cos A.

nodes.label: Alternative Double Angle Formulas
nodes.title: Alternative forms for sin 2A and cos 2A in terms of tan A.

nodes.label: Double Angle Formula for Tangent
nodes.title: Formula for tan 2A: tan 2A = 2 tan A / (1 – tan²A).

nodes.label: Power-Reducing Formula for Cosine
nodes.title: cos²A = ½ (1 + cos 2A), used to reduce powers of cosine.

nodes.label: Power-Reducing Formula for Sine
nodes.title: sin²A = ½ (1 – cos 2A), used to reduce powers of sine.

nodes.label: Product-to-Sum Formulas
nodes.title: Formulas expressing products of sines and cosines as sums: e.g., 2 cos A cos B = cos(A+B) + cos(A–B).

nodes.label: Sum-to-Product Formulas
nodes.title: Formulas expressing sums or differences of sines and cosines as products: e.g., cos A + cos B = 2 cos[(A+B)/2] cos[(A–B)/2].

nodes.label: Trigonometric Formula Derivation Procedure
nodes.title: The process of deriving trigonometric formulas using previously established identities.

nodes.label: Geometric Constructions
nodes.title: The process of drawing geometric shapes, angles, and figures using only specific tools such as a straightedge and compass.

nodes.label: Dynamic Geometry Software
nodes.title: Computer programs that allow users to construct and manipulate geometric figures dynamically.

nodes.label: Precision Instruments in Geometry
nodes.title: Use of tools such as straight edge, compass, ruler, protractor, and set square for accurate geometric constructions.

nodes.label: Circle Construction
nodes.title: Drawing a circle with a given radius using appropriate geometric tools.

nodes.label: Co-ordinate Plane
nodes.title: A two-dimensional surface on which points are plotted using pairs of numbers (coordinates).

nodes.label: Linear Relationships
nodes.title: Relationships between two variables that form a straight line when graphed; includes understanding slope and y-intercept.

nodes.label: Slope
nodes.title: A measure of the steepness of a line, equivalent to the rate of change in a linear relationship.

nodes.label: Point of Intersection
nodes.title: The point where two lines or curves meet on a graph.

nodes.label: Right-Angled Triangles
nodes.title: Triangles with one angle measuring 90 degrees, fundamental for trigonometry and Pythagoras' theorem.

nodes.label: Trigonometric Ratios
nodes.title: Ratios of the sides of a right-angled triangle: sine, cosine, and tangent.

nodes.label: Theorem of Pythagoras
nodes.title: A theorem stating that in a right-angled triangle, the square of the hypotenuse equals the sum of the squares of the other two sides.

nodes.label: Translations
nodes.title: A type of geometric transformation that slides a figure from one position to another without turning it.

nodes.label: Central Symmetry
nodes.title: A transformation where each point of a figure is mapped to another point directly opposite to a central point.

nodes.label: Axial Symmetry
nodes.title: A transformation producing a mirror image of a figure across a line (axis of symmetry).

nodes.label: Rotations
nodes.title: A transformation that turns a figure about a fixed point through a specified angle and direction.

nodes.label: Enlargements
nodes.title: A transformation that increases or decreases the size of a figure by a scale factor from a center of enlargement.

nodes.label: Scale Factor
nodes.title: A number which scales, or multiplies, some quantity; in geometry, used in enlargements and reductions.

nodes.label: Logic and Deductive Reasoning in Geometry
nodes.title: Use of logical terms and reasoning such as theorem, proof, axiom, corollary, converse, and proof by contradiction in geometric contexts.

nodes.label: Geometric Theorems and Proofs
nodes.title: Formal statements in geometry that are proven based on axioms and previously established theorems.
nodes.broader_concept: Logic and Deductive Reasoning in Geometry

nodes.label: Equation of a Line
nodes.title: The general form ax + by + c = 0 representing a straight line in the coordinate plane.

nodes.label: Parallel and Perpendicular Lines
nodes.title: Lines in the plane that are either always the same distance apart (parallel) or intersect at a right angle (perpendicular), often determined by their slopes.

nodes.label: Area of a Triangle (Coordinate Geometry)
nodes.title: Calculating the area of a triangle using coordinates of its vertices.

nodes.label: Equation of a Circle
nodes.title: The standard form (x-h)^2 + (y-k)^2 = r^2 and general form x^2 + y^2 + 2gx + 2fy + c = 0 representing a circle in the coordinate plane.

nodes.label: Distance from a Point to a Line
nodes.title: The shortest (perpendicular) distance from a given point to a given line in the coordinate plane.

nodes.label: Angle Between Two Lines
nodes.title: The measure of the angle formed where two lines intersect, calculated using their slopes.

nodes.label: Internal Division of a Line Segment
nodes.title: Dividing a line segment internally in a given ratio m:n using coordinates.
